summary: Email correspondence from the DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) to the USAO-SDNY regarding the transfer of electronic records from OPR's investigation into the USAO-SDFL's handling of the Epstein matter. The email includes a summary of records and offers options for transfer.

persons.name: Chief, Public Corruption USAO-SDNY
persons.context: Addressed as the recipient of the email from OPR regarding the transfer of investigation records related to the Epstein matter.

persons.name: Counsel Office of Professional Responsibility
persons.context: Author of the email offering to provide electronic records from OPR's investigation into the USAO-SDFL's handling of the Epstein case.

connections.description: OPR counsel is communicating with the Chief of Public Corruption at USAO-SDNY regarding the transfer of investigation materials.

events.title: OPR offers Epstein investigation records to USAO-SDNY
events.description: OPR emails the Chief of Public Corruption at USAO-SDNY to offer electronic records from OPR's investigation into the USAO-SDFL's handling of the Epstein matter.

locations: 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, NAV â€” Room 3266 Washington, D.C. 20530
keyFacts: OPR conducted an investigation into the USAO-SDFL's handling of the Epstein matter.
OPR is prepared to provide electronic records from that investigation to the USAO-SDNY, with the caveat they were collected for administrative purposes and may not be complete for criminal discovery.
The records include both electronic files and a smaller quantity of hard copy files that would require physical review.
The email correspondence indicates ongoing inter-agency coordination regarding the Epstein case investigations.
